name: The Warlord of the Hinterland (Barbarian 20 / Champion of Torm 18 / Rogue 2)
author: Orion

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
The Warlord of the Hinterland


Image source: https://i.pinimg.com/originals/f8/b9/64 ... f9bd92.jpg



Build notes:
I have really wanted to learn how to build Barbarians well for some time, and thought it was the right time to start.

This is something that I cooked up recently, not yet play-tested, but looks quite fun numbers wise.



Goals:
- Terrifying and Mighty Rage (requires Barbarian 20 or more)
- Base HP 500+, Epic Damage Reduction III with Barbarian Damage Reduction (4/- or more)
- Devastating Critical and Implosion Resistant (ie. excellent Fort Save)
- Evasion (requires Rogue 2+)
- Enjoyable to play both Solo and Party

Features:
- Melee base AB 42, Str 26, WF/EWF/IC: Battleaxe (or any melee weapon you wish), Epic Prowess/Armor Skin, Blind Fight/Knockdown, 1d6 sneak attack
- Base HP 712, Light/Medium/Heavy Armor Proficiency, Shield Proficiency, Tumble 40 (+8 AC), 
- Epic Damage Reduction III and Barbarian Damage Reduction for physical damage reduction 13/-
- Saves boosted by Luck of Heroes, Great Fortitude, 18 CoT Levels, Spellcraft crossclassed modified 10 (against spells), Uncanny dodge VI (against traps).
- Fort save 41/43/46, Will save 25/27/30, Reflex Save with Evasion 27/29/32.  [Saves / vs spells / vs traps]

- Terrifying Rage (level 24, initial DC 39+1d10), Lvl 40 Terrifying Rage DC: 55+1d10, duration 13-19 rounds (depending if cons is capped)
- Barbarian/Greater Rage 6x/day, Mighty Rage 3x/day (level 33). 
- Activate Mighty Rage before Greater Rage (not the other way round) to force two will saves/round, not that you need that.

- 230 skill points, max intimidate (55 modified), max spot, discipline 42(50), tumble 40 ranks, UMD 33 modified, spellcraft 10 modified cross-classed, search 10 modified etc etc

- Cool RP value from playing a Barbarian Champion


Image source: https://i.pinimg.com/originals/e3/91/94 ... f2c8e6.jpg



Probable weaknesses:
- No DC Magic spells (Bigby's, ILMS/IGMS).
- High sneak attackers (only partially mitigated by high spot score, and uncanny dodge VI which will prevent flanking sneak attacks from characters with 15 or less rogue/assassin/barbarian combined)
- Rolling a 1 against Dev Crit, Petrify Users or Implosion.
- Powerful ranged attackers (ie. Arcane Archers) +/- Intervening Terrain

Edit: 
Adjustments made after I discovered Terrifying Rage only requires Barb 15 and Mighty Rage only Barb 20. 
Further adjustments made - dropped Epic Fortitude, added 1 BAB by moving Rogue to epic levels, changed leveling split to Barbarian 20 / CoT 18 / Rogue 2.
Adjusted images for the build. Thanks GDL.



Image source: https://i.pinimg.com/736x/c4/6c/ab/c46c ... 883771.jpg

want level 40 maximum power might want a Rogue 2 / Barbarian 24 / Champion of Torm 14 split swapping some skill points/1d6 sneak for more HP and an extra Barbarian Bonus Feat, which could be spent on Thundering Rage, Epic Toughness or re-arrange the CoT feats to take an extra combat feat (unfortunately with Int 12 there isn't a huge amount to choose from).  Waiting till level 37 for a decent tumble/UMD score and evasion was too long in my opinion for a single player module user hence the middle skill dump & evasion being obtained.

posts.author: Zanithar
posts.content:
As an aforementioned mechanical builder (otherwise known as a minmaxer) I would likely drop 1 rogue (as noted) and add 1 barbarian. Then swap a Great Strength into a general feat and a barbarian feat into the Barbarian bonus feat. With the spare strength I would drop 1 Str and bump 2 Int for the starting stats. Netting 1 more rage per day (7 total) and some skills :)

But, IMO, barbarian is one of the classes that needs some attention in NWN. It does not offer enough to not take one of the other full melee classes.

With respect to build advice, I generally find that Barbarian is one of those classes that is a one trick pony with that trick being gather a crowd, panic the crowd and then gut the crowd. Personally I would spec into great sword or axe and go two handed. Drop to sword and board when you need a moment to heal. This lets you make the most out of your rage in my experience.

Sent from my iPad using Tapatalk

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Thanks for the suggestion Zanithar. 
With the higher Int score, one could also swap skill focus: intimidate for improved knockdown.
For the min-maxer of course :)

posts.author: Zanithar
posts.content:
I would definitely consider that as well, but for a general Barbarian build, unless you are on a server/world that is non-magical (meaning you cannot reach the stat cap), the one thing a Barbarian brings to the table is Panic. I would likely focus on that over Improved Knockdown by default as a result focusing on making that DC as high as possible. I would probably drop one of the save skills over SF: Intimidate but that really would be dependant on end game stuff, especially given it is a COT secondary.


Sent from my iPad using Tapatalk

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Have updated the build following Zanithar's suggestions, and learning a bit more about the barbarian class (thanks Stag for the build link in another thread).

I've increased the fort and will saves by 2 and reflex by 1 by increasing CT by 2 and dropping Barb by 2.
A player searching for maximum level 40 power will look for a Rogue 2 / Barb 20 / CT 18 split for an extra feat and an extra +1 to all saves, but the current build layout is listed for an enjoyable journey with regular skill dumps and getting evasion mid build.

Heh an unbuffed Fort save of 44 :)
Not sure I've see a fort save quite that high before in a build.
Anyone got any other examples? 
Expecting a few high Cha Paladin/Blackguard/CoT builds perhaps. Maybe rule out the ones with alignment changes

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Ahh thanks Zanithar I believe I have very quietly 'Ninja' posted you. 

With Terrifying Rage its Barb 15 and Mighty Rage its is Barb 20 according to the Wiki.

posts.author: Zanithar
posts.content:
Paladin does not need to be deep charisma build, low but buffed works. You can clear 50.

24 Paladin / 15 CoT / 1 Rogue for example (15 CoT for divine Wrath ... since you are capping Charisma).


Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk

posts.author: Zanithar
posts.content:
Orion2019 wrote:Ahh thanks Zanithar I believe I have very quietly 'Ninja' posted you. 

With Terrifying Rage its Barb 15 and Mighty Rage its is Barb 20 according to the Wiki.
I am unconvinced but I have not built a barbarian in a non custom world in an exceptionally long time, so I defer to the wiki until I can test :)


Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content: It's correct. Terrifying Rage and Thundering Rage are available with Barb15, Mighty Rage is available with Barb20.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Hi everyone,

Thanks for the comments
I made adjustments to the build, moving Rogue to epic levels (for +1AB), adjusting the level split to Barb 20 / CoT 18 / Rogue 2. 
Fit in toughness and great constitution as the Fort saves are great.
It hits 700hp+.
I like not taking Rogue level 1 because it allows me to take Heavy Armor Proficiency from level 1, and not having to suffer on level 1 playing a low dex high str rogue.
Also did a search using DPA's filter for Barb 20+ builds.

Anyone got any other examples? 
Expecting a few high Cha Paladin/Blackguard/CoT builds perhaps. Maybe rule out the ones with alignment changes
There are quite a few:  Cinnabar's Favored of Moradin gets a 46.

I really like this one, Orion, I think you got a winner.  Though you should do something about the picture.  He looks too knightly.  I pictured more of divine champion of some heathen god of the north. ;)

posts.content:
Thanks GDL and Zanithar.
Indeed the previous image was looking too knightly and friendly.
I think you will find the three pictures I found a bit more to your taste.
And yes more Antlers, even Antlered Helmets (@Stagmeister reference)
